events.originalText: Jo Cox, a British Member of Parliament, was murdered in her constituency.
events.subtitle: Jo Cox
events.headline: British MP Jo Cox murdered in her constituency

events.originalText: Liu Yang (pictured), a member of the Shenzhou 9 crew, became the first Chinese woman in space.
events.subtitle: Liu Yang (taikonaut)
events.headline: Chinese astronaut Liu Yang first woman in space

events.originalText: The English rock band Radiohead released their landmark third album OK Computer.
events.subtitle: Radiohead
events.headline: Radiohead releases landmark album OK Computer

events.originalText: English musician David Bowie released his breakthrough album, The Rise and Fall of Ziggy Stardust and the Spiders from Mars.
events.subtitle: David Bowie
events.headline: David Bowie releases breakthrough album Ziggy Stardust

events.originalText: Aboard Vostok 6, Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova (pictured) became the first woman in space.
events.subtitle: Vostok 6
events.headline: Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova first woman in space

events.originalText: Psycho, a psychological horror film directed by Alfred Hitchcock (pictured) and based on a novel of the same name by Robert Bloch, premiered.
events.subtitle: Psycho (1960 film)
events.headline: Alfred Hitchcock's Psycho premieres

events.originalText: A Junkers Ju 52 aircraft of Norwegian Air Lines crashed into a mountainside near Hyllestad, Norway, killing all seven people on board.
events.subtitle: Junkers Ju 52
events.headline: Norwegian Air Lines aircraft crash kills seven

events.originalText: The technology company IBM was founded as the Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company in Endicott, New York.
events.subtitle: IBM
events.headline: IBM founded as Computing-Tabulating-Recording Company

events.originalText: Irish author James Joyce began a relationship with Nora Barnacle, and subsequently used the date to set the actions for his 1922 novel Ulysses, commemorated as Bloomsday.
events.subtitle: James Joyce
events.headline: James Joyce begins relationship with Nora Barnacle

events.originalText: In the Victoria Hall disaster, 183 children were crushed to death when they ran down the stairs to collect gifts after a variety show in Sunderland, England.
events.subtitle: Victoria Hall disaster
events.headline: Victoria Hall disaster kills 183 children in England

events.originalText: A strong earthquake in the Kutch district of Gujarat, India, caused a local zone of uplift that dammed the Nara River, which was later named the Allah Bund ('Dam of God').
events.subtitle: 1819 Rann of Kutch earthquake
events.headline: Strong earthquake in Gujarat causes local uplift

events.originalText: After a two-week siege, the French commander of Fort Beauséjour in present-day New Brunswick, Canada, surrendered to British forces, marking the end of Father Le Loutre's War.
events.subtitle: Battle of Fort Beauséjour
events.headline: French commander surrenders to British forces in Canada

events.originalText: The Plymouth Company granted a land patent to Thomas Purchase, who became the first permanent European settler of Pejepscot, Maine.
events.subtitle: Plymouth Company
events.headline: Thomas Purchase becomes first European settler of Pejepscot

events.originalText: Ming forces conquered Đại Ngu in modern-day northern Vietnam, capturing Hồ dynasty emperor Hồ Quý Ly and bringing the country under Chinese rule.
events.subtitle: Ming dynasty
events.headline: Ming forces conquer Đại Ngu in northern Vietnam

events.originalText: The final king of the Sasanian Empire of Iran, Yazdegerd III, ascended the throne at the age of eight.
events.subtitle: Sasanian Empire
events.headline: Yazdegerd III ascends throne as final Sasanian king
